N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 6.1 - Government and control

State Regulations

The commissioner is hereby charged with the following powers
and duties in relation to the New York State School for the Blind: (a) He shall have general control, supervision and management thereof and shall establish regulations for the
accomplishment of its purposes and objects. (b) He shall have the custody, keeping and
management of its grounds, buildings and all its other property. (c) He shall determine the number of heads of
departments and other positions. (d) Whenever more persons apply for admission
than can be accomodated, the commissioner shall so apportion the number
received that each county shall be represented in the ratio established by
law. (e) Whenever it shall be
deemed necessary by the commissioner to have a pupil permanently removed from
the school in accordance with the bylaws and regulations thereof, such pupil
shall be promptly removed by his parents, guardians or friends upon the order
of the commissioner. If the parent, guardian or friends of any pupil shall
fail, through neglect or inability, to provide him with proper clothing or with
funds to defray his necessary traveling expenses, or to remove him, the
commissioner shall furnish such clothing, pay such traveling expenses or remove
[continued ] such pupil to the care of the public welfare official or the
public welfare district in which he has his legal residence. (f) In case of the death at the school of any
pupil whose body shall not be removed or whose funeral expenses shall not be
paid by his parents, guardians or friends, the commissioner shall pay the
necessary burial expenses and charge them to the public welfare district in
which the pupil had his legal residence. Notes
